article.name: Integrate CnSight with Your KnowBe4 Console
article.title: Integrate CnSight with Your KnowBe4 Console
article.body:
In this article, you’ll learn how to integrate your CnSight platform with your KSAT console. This integration will allow you to send phishing data from your KSAT console to your CnSight platform to provide a broader view of your organization’s cybersecurity performance.

Note: Before you set up this integration, you'll need to copy the Reporting API Token from your KSAT Account Settings. For more information, see the API section of our KSAT Account Settings: Account Integrations article.

To learn how to integrate your KSAT console with your CnSight platform, follow the steps below:

  1. Log in to your CnSight account.
  2. Click Integration Center from the Organization drop-down menu.

  3. Scroll to the KnowBe4 card in the Security Training & Awareness section.

  4. Click the pencil icon.
  5. Paste your Reporting API token in the KnowBe4 API Token field.

  6. Click Submit.

You will see a green confirmation message notifying you of the successful connection.

To verify that the integration was successful, click the clock icon on the KnowBe4 card. A drop-down menu will appear with the status and timestamp of the most recent data sync.

Once the connection is established, click Phishing Incidents And Training from the Security Functions drop-down menu to get a detailed report of all Cybersecurity Performance Indicators (CPIs) and phishing results.

images.alt:
This image depicts a segment of a web application interface, focusing on a navigation menu dropdown.

**Header/Navigation Bar:**
The top section features the logo and product name, "Cnsight," on the left. The main navigation bar includes the links: "Dashboard," "Organization" (currently active or hovered), and "Security Functions."

**Dropdown Menu:**
A dropdown menu is expanded beneath the "Organization" link. The options visible are:
1. **Integration Center** (Highlighted with a light blue/gray background and an orange bounding box, indicating selection or focus).
2. CPI Center
3. CPI Customizer
4. Business Unit Performance
5. Profile Page
6. RisknSight
7. My organization
8. User Management

**Page Context:**
The primary page content visible below the navigation bar displays the heading: "Phishing Incidents And Train[ing...]." Below this title, a blurred or masked chart area is visible, including a vertical axis labeled "Percentage (%)" with tick marks for 60, 80, and 100.
images.context: Integration Center from the Organization drop-down menu.

images.alt:
The image displays a user interface (UI) dashboard section titled **"Security Training & Awareness."** The content is presented in a two-row grid of actionable tiles/cards, representing different security awareness and training vendors or categories.

**Overall Structure:**
The interface shows five integration tiles against a white background. Three tiles are in the top row, and two (plus implied space for more) are in the bottom row.

**Detailed Tile Analysis (Left to Right, Top to Bottom):**

1.  **HackerOne Tile:** Features a black stylized 'h1' logo.
    *   Title: "HackerOne"
    *   Status: "Not Reporting Yet" (Displayed in gray text).
    *   Action Icons: Checkbox (square outline), Edit (pencil icon), and Refresh (circular arrow icon).

2.  **Cofense Phishing Tile:** Features a red and black Cofense logo.
    *   Title: "Phishing"
    *   Status: "Reporting" (Displayed in light blue text).
    *   Action Icons: Checkbox, Edit, and Refresh (all light blue outline).

3.  **Defender Tile:** Features the blue Windows Defender shield logo.
    *   Title: "Defender"
    *   Status: "Reporting" (Displayed in light blue text).
    *   Action Icons: Checkbox, Edit, and Refresh (all light blue outline).

4.  **KnowBe4 Tile (Highlighted):** This tile is visually emphasized with a thick orange bounding box, indicating selection or current focus.
    *   Icon: Small orange/red "KnowBe4" text logo.
    *   Title: "KnowBe4"
    *   Status: "Reporting" (Displayed in light blue text).
    *   Action Icons: Edit and Refresh (light blue outline).

5.  **Add More Tile:** Serves as a placeholder for new integrations.
    *   Icon: Large gray plus sign (+) inside a square border.
    *   Title: "Add More"
    *   Status: "Not Reporting Yet" (Displayed in gray text).
    *   Action Icons: Edit and Refresh (gray outline, indicating inactive or placeholder status).

A mouse cursor (arrow pointer) is visible near the bottom right of the "Add More" tile. Status indicators differentiate between active integrations ("Reporting") and inactive or unconfigured integrations ("Not Reporting Yet").
images.context: ong>KnowBe4 card in the Security Training & Awareness section.

images.alt:
This image displays a configuration panel within the **KnowBe4 Reporting** interface.

**Header and Context:**
The application header shows "KnowBe4" and the current module, "Reporting." Action icons include a checked box (Save/Apply), a pencil (Edit), and a refresh icon.

**Input Fields:**
The panel includes two text input fields:
1.  An input field labeled "**Last Activity**."
2.  A critical input field labeled "**KnowBe4 API Token**." This field is currently empty and is highlighted by a prominent orange rectangular border, indicating it is the required focus for configuration.

**Call-to-Action Buttons:**
At the bottom of the panel are two call-to-action buttons:
*   A primary action button labeled "**Submit**" (light blue outline/fill).
*   A secondary action button labeled "**Cancel**" (white background, red text).
images.context: your Reporting API token in the KnowBe4 API Token field.

images.alt:
The image displays a UI card element containing a section header and associated actions.

**Text and Context:**

*   **Primary Title:** KnowBe4
*   **Secondary Title/Context:** Reporting (in blue font)
*   **Branding Element (Left):** The text "KnowBe4" in a light orange/reddish font.

**UI Elements:**

*   **Status Indicator:** An upward-pointing caret (`^`) located next to the primary title, typically indicating a collapsible or expandable state (currently expanded).
*   **Edit Action:** A small light-blue pencil/stylus icon, indicating an "Edit" function.
*   **Refresh Action:** A button on the far right, highlighted by an orange bounding box (indicating focus or interactive area), containing a light-blue icon representing a refresh, circular history, or sync function (a counter-clockwise curved arrow).
images.context: drop-down menu will appear with the status and timestamp of the most recent data sync.

images.alt:
The image displays a screenshot of the **CnSight** operational dashboard interface.

**Header and Navigation:**
The top navigation bar contains the product logo ("CnSight") and main navigational links: "Dashboard," "Organization," and "Security Functions." The "Security Functions" link is highlighted (light blue underline), indicating it is the active parent element for the visible flyout menu.

**Main Content:**
The page title is **"Operational Dashboard."** Content areas are partially visible, including a section titled **"My Integrations"** and another titled **"Performance Improvement Recommendations."**

**Flyout Menu (Security Functions):**
A vertical flyout menu, triggered by the "Security Functions" header link, is displayed on the right side of the screen. The menu items are listed as follows:

1.  Vulnerability Management
2.  Inventory Management
3.  Encryption Management
4.  Account and Access Management
5.  Network Management
6.  **Phishing Incidents And Training** (This option is selected/in focus, indicated by a grey background and an externally applied orange bounding box.)
7.  End Point Configuration
8.  Audit and Testing
9.  Malware and Web Protection
10. Network Device Configuration
images.context: all Cybersecurity Performance Indicators (CPIs) and phishing results.
